channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-13569] correct errors reported with mvn site
item.description: There are a number of Javadoc errors reported when running mvn site.
item.summary: correct errors reported with mvn site

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
When running with Java 8
http://blog.joda.org/2014/02/turning-off-doclint-in-jdk-8-javadoc.html

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12728281/HBASE-13569.patch
against master branch at commit 75507af9f80716a2dac2dd3d1642d70373976915.
ATTACHMENT ID: 12728281

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

-1 patch. The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/13823//console

This message is automatically generated.
Took a quick look. This patch is very nice cleanup. Thanks for working on it Gabor Liptak.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12728527/HBASE-13569.1.patch
against master branch at commit 2759fd0cdbb8aee928819c9d7306bb61c94126d8.
ATTACHMENT ID: 12728527

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

+1 hadoop versions. The patch compiles with all supported hadoop versions (2.4.1 2.5.2 2.6.0)

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 protoc. The applied patch does not increase the total number of protoc compiler warnings.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

-1 checkstyle. The applied patch generated 1910 checkstyle errors (more than the master's current 1898 errors).

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

-1 lineLengths. The patch introduces the following lines longer than 100:
+ * public void myMethod(RpcController controller, MyRequest request, RpcCallback<MyResponse> done) {
+ * expression can contain visibility labels combined with logical operators AND(&), OR(|) and NOT
+ * Cell implements Comparable<Cell> which is only meaningful when comparing to other keys in the
+ * memory size to give to the cache (if < 1.0) OR, it is the capacity in megabytes of the cache.
+ * <code><keylength> <valuelength> <key> <value></code> Key is further decomposed as:
+ * <code><rowlength> <row> <columnfamilylength> <columnfamily> <columnqualifier>
+ * <code><taglength><tagtype><tagbytes></code>. <code>tagtype</code> is one byte and
+ * <code><hostname> '

{@link #SERVERNAME_SEPARATOR}' <port> '{@link #SERVERNAME_SEPARATOR}

' <startcode></code>.
+ *

{@link org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.SplitLogManagerCoordination#removeStaleRecoveringRegions(Set)}

+ * <code>void filterRow(List<KeyValue> kvs)</code> removing all the kvs from the passed List</li>

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.TestImportExport
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.util.TestProcessBasedCluster

-1 core zombie tests. There are 5 zombie test(s):

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/13848//testReport/
Release Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/13848//artifact/patchprocess/newFindbugsWarnings.html
Checkstyle Errors: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/13848//artifact/patchprocess/checkstyle-aggregate.html

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/13848//console

This message is automatically generated.
Hi Gabor Liptak! are you still working on this issue? I don't think the test failures are related, but could you clean up the long lines called out by the QA bot?
Sean Busbey yes, I will review the long line warnings and submit an updated patch.
Rebase to current trunk

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 javac. The patch appears to cause mvn compile goal to fail with Hadoop version 2.4.1.

-1 lineLengths. The patch introduces the following lines longer than 100:
+ *

{@link org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.SplitLogManagerCoordination#removeStaleRecoveringRegions(Set)}

+ * @param expected expected amount of time for the operation to complete (ms) (ideally, expected <= end-start)
+ * <pre><data blocks><meta blocks><fileinfo><data index><meta index><trailer></pre>
+ * Pass <code> <hbase.zookeeper.quorum>:<hbase.zookeeper.client.port>:<zookeeper.znode.parent>
+ * Pass <code> <hbase.zookeeper.quorum>:<hbase.zookeeper.client.port>:<zookeeper.znode.parent>
+ * Removes a Cell from the memstore. The Cell is removed only if its key & memstoreTS match the
+ * <-1, 3, <Keyvalue-for-edit-c1>, <KeyValue-for-edit-c2>, <KeyValue-for-edit-c3>>
+ * check if /hbase/recovering-regions/<current region encoded name> exists. Returns true if exists

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

Sean Busbey Please review. Thanks

My apologies for the delay. I rebased to current master (there was one minor conflict to solve), however in the interim period additional javadoc errors have crept into the code base.

Gabor Liptak would you prefer to update this issue for current master, or have me push the additional errors into a follow on ticket?
Sean Busbey Considering the number of files touched in this ticket, the best way might be to commit this (updated) patch and I can work the rest of them in a followup ticket.
agreed. until the pre-commit check flags the problem we'll be running to keep up.
Do you need me to rebase to current master (or can you upload your version)?
I pushed to master already and am now working through the conflicts on cherry-pick to branch-1. I'll take care of the rest of this, feel free to take a stab at the follow on if you ahve time now.

SUCCESS: Integrated in HBase-TRUNK #6569 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-TRUNK/6569/)

thanks for cleaning this up. pushed to master and branch-1. If folks would like it pulled back farther, please let me know. there were conflicts going to branch-1.1, but nothing that looked tedious.

filed HBASE-13898 to take care of the rest. hopefully I'll get precommit in place by the time that lands.
